snippet: A rinse may be able to predict the recurrence of a kind of throat cancer that is rapidly increasing in heterosexual men, according to a new study.
abstract: Gypsyamber D’Souza study in journal JAMA Oncology reports simple mouthwash rinse may be effective in predicting recurrence of throat cancer caused by human papilloma virus; throat cancer is on rise among young men who perform oral sex on female partners.
lead_paragraph: A rinse may be able to predict the recurrence of a kind of throat cancer that is rapidly increasing in heterosexual men, according to a new study.

headline.print_headline: A Mouthwash Rinse May Predict Cancer
headline.main: A Mouthwash Rinse May Predict Throat Cancer Recurrence
